data.title: Fun Even for Adults!
data.text: My wife and I went here as sort of a stay-cation. The space exhibit was quite exciting. My favorite part was controlling a lunar robot. The Deep Sea Imaginarium was going on at the same time and was a unique and happy exhibit.

data.title: VERY COOL!!
data.text: Very impressive inside.  We didn't get a chance to explore everywhere but did have a good time at the Discovery Science and went to the Cinedome.  The gal at the information desk was very helpful and very informative it was neat learning about the building

data.title: Mulit purpose venue with many events!
data.text: A key cultural institution located in the heart of Sioux Falls. Once a major high school it has been transformed in to a history, art and cultural center. Wide range of events and a beautiful theater will keep you coming back. Check out their web page for much more information.

data.title: Why go out of state, when Washington has it all
data.text:
The Washington Pavilion does an excellent job of bringing in great touring Broadway show companies to perform with ticket prices being reasonable.

We love taking the entire family to shows and find the location to be wonderful for finding dining prior to a show, or drinks after if it is an adult gathering.

data.title: WOW
data.text: Excellent facility. always clean and what a building. historic and beautiful enjoy all that is offered. well worth the trip to see this

data.title: Lovely Venue
data.text: We are fortunate to have such a wonderful space to watch,shows, concerts and more. The variety they bring to Sioux Falls is delightful, opportunities to see a wide variety of performances.

data.title: M Ring
data.text: Visited the pavilion for a wedding. It was a great place. The theater was a great setting. The reception was held on the stage, as well as the dance. It made it feel very elegant,  even though it was a very simple beautiful wedding.

data.title: Need to update and fix some stuff in science center
data.text: The science center has gone downhill for frequent visitors. If it is your 1st time it will still be ok, but if you have been there in the last 2 years don't bother - nothing has changed except less stuff works. They really need to do some updates and repairs, it is pretty sad.  Last time we went many things were out of order and broken. I was disappointed because I bought a season pass in order to get ticket presales and then was never notified of presales like I was told / lead to believe I would be. Tried to get on to buy tickets to a concert and attempted 3 times and was kicked off after I put in my credit card. But, I did finally get 2 tickets together and 1 other and when I went to the concert and explained, they did let my 8 year old daughter sit on my lap since we actually did have 3 tickets...but...well, you get it! Tried to buy something to drink between singers and there were only 2 bartenders on our level, was told to go downstairs because there were 6 bartenders there and no line...well, duh send them up to help? our seats are here! There was decent leg room with seating at least.

owner_response.author: WashPav, Digital Marketing Specialist at Washington Pavilion, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Tasia, thank you for recently visiting the Washington Pavilion. We appreciate your feedback as we always strive to offer our guests the best possible experience. Our science center has been closed for the installation of a brand new exhibition on our 2nd floor: “Space: An Out-of-this-World Experience.” If you’re in town, we invite you to join us this weekend, August 19-21, for the grand opening of this exciting gallery. We also want our patrons to have a positive experience purchasing tickets and attending performances. Please contact our Patron Services Director to discuss this further at 605-367-7397 or 877-WASH PAV.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: pavilion
data.text: This building was a High School before they built a new school on the east side. There great educational information in the building. They hold concerts in the main hall and preforming arts. special area for the children to learn about science and Sioux falls. A great attraction for all ages.

data.title: Something for everyone
data.text: The Washington Pavilion is an historic building.  There is three floors of hands-on science exhibits for kids of all ages.  The gift shop is nice.  There is also a Cinedome and a free art section.  There is a small theater for plays and concerts.  Definitely a fun place.  Volunteers and staff are friendly and helpful.

data.title: Great Place to go Anytime
data.text: Washington Pavilion has something for all ages to enjoy.  The theatre is awesome 3D. If your into science this is the place for you to take your kids, You will be amazed at what is there.

data.title: Lots of great entertainment.
data.text: The pavilion has a lot of static exhibits that change from time to time.  there is also the big screen to watch movies and documentaries on.  Watch for special off broadway events also!

data.title: Kirby Science Discovery Center Great for Kids
data.text: We took two small children to this museum and had a great time. There is a room for children age 7 and under which was where they both had the most fun. There even was an area for children under the age of 1. However, there were some children in the room who were older than 7 and a couple of children who took over the slides and would not allow younger children to have a chance at going down a slide.

data.title: washington Pavillion
data.text: Historic building in downtown souix falls only about 5 blocks from downtown holiday inn. Many floors of various exhibits and many different entertainment options.

data.title: Disappointed with our visit.
data.text: This venue is mostly for young kids. The "Science Museum" is 3 floors of children's hands on exhibits. The day of our visit there were 6 bus loads of students, so even if you brought children I don't know that they would have fun since there were already so many kids (200+) and many exhibits were broken. Although we paid for the Imax, we were turned away at the door because all the seats were reserved for the school kids. When we went to the desk to get a refund for the movie it became a big production and the cashier was very put out. The Visual Arts center was OK, but not worth a stop if that's all you are there for.

owner_response.author: WashPav, Marketing Specialist at Washington Pavilion, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Mike, thank you for visiting the Washington Pavilion. We are sorry to hear you are disappointed with your experience. The day you were here we were very active with school groups and a few sold out show times for our mission films. We understand your schedule may not have allowed you to return for the next available show time. If possible, we invite you to join us late summer when we open a new exhibition on 2nd floor. The 15 new exhibits will allow us to retire some of the older exhibits you may have come across. If you have any questions or would like to discuss further, please contact Patron Services at 605-367-7397 or 877-WASH PAV.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: This place has it all
data.text:
Very deceiving from the outside, and quite different and well rounded inside, has everything, certainly worth  looking into, when your in town.
Something for everyone..

data.title: First Class
data.text: If your staying at a Hotel I suggest the Ramkota Best Western with a FREE shuttle ride to this venue.Walk downtown after the event and enjoy a variety of food and drink options.Really not a bad seat at the Pavilion but my choice is the side seating because of the easy access to a bathroom break or to get a drink.If you are in the middle the seats have a lot of leg room for people to pass by.Enjoy the show and the friendly staff.

data.title: Captivating downtown location for events
data.text: Having attended several conferences here over the past years, as well as several shows, I've always had a wonderful experience at the Washington Pavilion. There is local student art that graces the interior, and other fascinating things to experience and view. The Pavilion is also home to the Kirby Science Discovery Center ($$), Visual Arts Center (free), Cinedome ($), an exhibit from the SD Rock and Roll Music Association (free), and Leonardo's Cafe($-$$). Definitely something for everyone.

data.title: Kirby Science Center
data.text: We visited on a Saturday afternoon in early April. Our almost 3 year old had a great time! Some of the exhibits were a little beyond his age range, which we expected. Still, there was plenty for him to do and see. There was an exhibit the consisted of a huge network of tubes and gears that you put plastic balls in. He could have stayed there all day and the fun he had was worth the price of admission! Very impressed. We will be back.

data.title: Beautiful venue
data.text: We have gone to same incredible concerts at the Pavilion it is so nice and I don't think there is a bad seat in the house.
